Posts.Content: Good Luck! Mayo treated me well. TM
Posts.Signature: Started at age 68 PSA 9/2018 14.8, 11/2018 20.16 Biopsy 11/2018 Adenocarcinoma in 7 of 9 cores (3%, 60%, 80%, 90%) Gleason 4+3 Robotic prostatectomy nerve sparing, 1/10/18 Mayo Clinic, Dr. Matthew Gettman, Very experienced and highly recommended. Final pathology Gleason 4+3 = 7, Grade Group 3, Tumor size 1.6cm, Margins negative, 5 Lymph Nodes, 0 involved. Adenocarcinoma involves the right seminal vesicle and extraprostatic soft tissue in regions of the left and right superior posterior prostate. Primary Tumor pT3b. Catheter out in 7 days. Still fighting dribbles and ED after 4 weeks, but hey, no cancer at this point. Feb 2019 PSA <0.1 3 month PSA <0.1

Posts.Title: Finally time

Posts.Content: The snow is finally melting in Minnesota and I received the 3 month after surgery PSA results. <0.10 So far, so good. Good wishes to everybody else! TM

Posts.Title: Spring and 3 month PSA

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by DjinTonic Excellent, TM! Your primary treatment is over with a great first PSA. Given your EPE+ and SVI+ path report, you may want to ask your doc about following your PSA with a 2- or 3- decimal uPSA test. Are you on a 3-month test schedule? Djin Yes, three month schedule. Thanks for the suggestion. I will mention the more sensitive test before my next appointment. I am just going to put it out of my mind for a couple of months. TM

Posts.Title: Spring and 3 month PSA

Posts.Content: I just got back from the urologist after my 5 weeks appointment. PSA is currently not detectable. Sounds way better than 20. This makes the dribbles much easier to handle. TM
